{% extends "_layouts/skeleton.html" %} {% set content %} # Requests template reference You can access information about the current HTTP request via the `pt.request` variable. Note that in addition to the methods detailed below, the `pt.request` variable also provides access to all the methods implemented in the [Symfony2 Request class](http://api.symfony.com/2.0/Symfony/Component/HttpFoundation/Request.html). ## Available methods

pt.request.getUrlPath()

Gets the full URL path of the request (excluding the `index.php` segment if present).

{% raw %}
{{ pt.request.getUrlPath() }}
{% endraw %}

pt.request.getUrlSegments()

Returns an array of all the individual segments in the URL.

pt.request.getUrlSegment( position )

Gets a URL segment, identified by it's position pos from the start of the URL path.

pt.request.getQueryString( [ overrides ] )

Returns GET request string from the current request, optionally providing a key:value hash of overrides to overwrite or append to the string.

pt.request.getQueryParam( name )

Returns the value of the GET parameter specified by `name`, if set.

pt.request.getQueryParams()

Returns a key:value hash of all the GET paramters set in the URL.

pt.request.getPostParams()

Returns a key:value hash of all the POST paramters set in the URL.

pt.request.getSchemeAndHttpHost()

Returns the scheme and host name from the request

{% raw %}
{{ pt.request.getSchemeAndHttpHost() }}
{% endraw %}

pt.request.getHttpHost()

Returns the host name from the request

{% raw %}
{{ pt.request.getHttpHost() }}
{% endraw %}
{% endset %}
